---
title: Upgrade Execution
---           
 
Follow the steps to Upgrade your existing Maximo environment:

## 1. Prepare Database
- Prepare your database by duplicating or back up the existing Maximo production database.

## 2. Install and Configure Maximo Application Suite (MAS)
- Install [MAS](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/mas84/8.4.0?topic=installing-maximo-application-suite).
- Save superuser credentials and admin url from the MAS installtion summary. 
- Login to MAS using superuser credentials.

![image](images/suite.png)     

### Create Admin User
- Create an admin user from Users page.
- Login as admin user. 

![image](images/newuser.png)  

## System Configuration 
- Go to Configuration tile.
- You can configure LDAP or SAML for authentication. 
- Configure SMTP
  - An SMTP server connection is needed to enable email notifications for Maximo Application Suite system events such as new user welcome emails and password reset communication.
  - During upgrade, all the existing Maximo users will be migrated to Manage. 
  - The maxadmin user will be created in MAS with password maxadminmaxadmin#1.

![image](images/smtp.png)  

## 3. Create Customization Archive
- Skip this step if you don't have customization.
- Follow [Customization](customizationprocess) page. Sample [customization archive](https://github.com/ibm-mas-manage/playbook/blob/master/customization)

## 4. Deploy and Configure Manage 
### Configure and Deploy Manage, Industry Solutions and Addons
- Go to Catalog, click Manage tile.

![image](images/managetile.png) 

- Select Manage, Industry Solutions and Addons.

![image](images/addon.png)  

- Deploy 

![image](images/managedeploy.png)  

- Configure
  - Go to Actions on the top right of the page. Select `Configure Workspace`.
  
![image](images/configurews.png)  


  - Configure database
    - Click on configure 

![image](images/dbconfigure.png)   


  - Configure schema, tablespace, certificates.
    - If you are using encryption, add your encryption keys.

![image](images/databaseconf.png)  

  - Configure languages

![image](images/langserver.png) 

  - Configure server bundles. See [Configuration](../configuration) page for bundle level propertites.
  
![image](images/serverbundles.png) 

  - Configure customization archieve if needed.

![image](images/customization.png) 

  - Import external certificate if needed.

![image](images/importcertificate.png) 

## 5. Activate 

- Click on Activate blue button on top right when you see ready to be activated message.

![image](images/activate.png)  

## Deployment Status

- You can check the deployment status. Go to Catalog, Click on Manage tile.

![image](images/deploymentstatus1.png) 



![image](images/deploymentstatus2.png) 
   
## Manage Application Status
- Green button on the Manage tile shows Manage application is ready.

![image](images/active.png)  

## Update Manage Configuration
- If you need to update the configuration
  - Go to Catalog, click on the Manage tile and select `Configure Workspace` from `Action` drop down list.
  - Update configuration and Activate.
